name: 霍弘毅
objective: In this course (which is a continuation of Advanced Writing from Autumn 2007) we will continue to learn the techniques of style in written English through the careful and creative morphology of the basic units of English grammar (the Word, the Phrase, and the Clause) into syntax.  We will, in addition, focus on the basic structures of, and purposes for, the paragraph.  The goal of the course is to de-mystify and render transparent what counts as ‘good’, ‘serious’, and ‘beautiful’ English writing.  Thus we will look at the strategic use of basic grammar units—Noun Phrases, Verb Phrases, Dependent Clauses, Parallelisms, Sentences Openers and Inversions, Free Modifiers and ‘Branching’, Cohesion, and others—in order to create fluid, concise, and professional English.
schedule: Texts: Dr. Wall’s Guide to Basic Grammar and Syntax As Style
